3.t: and by the witness (Muhammad) and that which is witnessed (the Day of Judgment),

4.t: may the people be condemned those who tortured (the believers) in ditches

6.t: while they themselves sat around it

8.t: The only reason for which they tormented the believers was the latter's belief in God, the Majestic, and Praiseworthy.
8.tr: Wa-maa naqamoo minhum illaaa ai yu'minoo billaahil 'azeezil Hameed

9.t: and the One to whom belongs the heavens and the earth. God is the Witness of all things.
9.tr: Allazee lahoo mulkus samaawaati wal-ard; wallaahu 'alaa kulli shai-'in Shaheed

10.t: Those who persecute the believing men and women without repenting will suffer the torment of hell and that of the burning fire.
10.tr: Innal lazeena fatanul mu'mineena wal-mu'minaati summa lam yatooboo falahum 'azaabu Jahannama Wa-lahum 'azaabul hareeq

11.t: As for the righteously striving believers, they will live in Paradise wherein streams flow. This is the greatest triumph.
11.tr: Innal lazeena aamanoo Wa-'amilus saalihaati lahum Jannaatun tajree min tahtihal anhaar; zaalikal fawzul kabeer

12.t: The vengeance of God is terribly severe.

13.t: It is He who creates all things and causes them to return.

14.t: He is the All-forgiving, the Most Loving One,

15.t: the Owner of the Throne, the Glorious One,

16.t: and the Most Effective in His decision.

17.t: Have you not heard about the stories of the armies

19.t: In fact, the disbelievers had always rejected (Our revelations).

21.t: What is revealed to you is certainly a glorious Quran

22.t: that exists in a well-guarded tablet.
